sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: As if to mock his desire to not remember, Will accidentally glances at a flower shop. Just like the bakery, this is one of the shops that he and Anna know.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: That day, Will and Anna were talking about a flower they both saw in the shop.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Hey hey Will, look. Why do I feel like we have seen that flower before?

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Really? Well, It does seem familiar.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Oh oh oh, I remember now. We’ve seen this in that book.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: That book, the one that tells a story about (. . . .).

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: The one with that flower in the cover, c'mon. . . we read it together in the library.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Hurghhh. . . I. . . still don’t remember haha.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: ugh. . . Actually nevermind that. . . Let’s just go.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Anna begins walking away without waiting for Will.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Eh. . .? Eh. . . Hey Anna, wait for me.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Will starts walking, following Anna. Anna walks fast, but Will isn’t slow either. He doesn’t want to lose her. But that was that day.
